utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, are you from Star Wars universe?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Were you in the original trilogy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Is there a picture of you in my wallet wearing a metal bikini?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: God, I hope not. And no, I’m not Princess Leia.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, okay, okay, my turn. Are you in the six Star Wars movies?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Interesting. Are you a Droid?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Do you kind of look like a shiny Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: C3PO.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s preposterous. I do not resemble C3PO. Don’t get me wrong, I’m flattered, I just don’t see it.

utterance.speaker: Howard (phone rings)
utterance.content: Leslie Winkle. You’ve reached friends with benefits. For a booty call, press one now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What exactly does that expression mean, friends with benefits? Does he provide her with health insurance?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. Look, imagine you maintained a friendship with someone you had sex with, but you were free to date whoever you wanted.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I can’t imagine any of that.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Alright, back to the game.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I believe it’s my turn, you may begin your questions whenever you’re ready.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you Spock?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t like this game.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So, where were we?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Aren’t you leaving for your booty call?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, it was something else. Why does everything have to be about sex with you? Come on. Who’s turn is it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We were up to you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Great, just start.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, let’s see. Are you from a TV series?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She dumped me!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I bet he’s someone from Babylon 5, we’re never going to guess.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What happened with Leslie, why did she dump you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t know. She just said Howard, momma’s a rolling stone. And then her call waiting beeped and she was gone.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t understand. If you were in a non-emotional relationship then why are you having what appears be an emotional response?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, he obviously had feelings for her.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Of course I had feelings for her, I saw her naked for God’s sake!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, uh look, you just need to get your mind off it. Do you want to go to the comic book store? Maybe go see a movie?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t want to go anywhere.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, I’m given to understand that there is an entire city in Nevada designed specifically to help people like Howard forget their problems. Where you can replace them with new problems such as alcoholism, gambling addiction and sexually transmitted diseases.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Is it me, or was that Sheldon’s way of saying Vegas baby!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ve never been there, have you?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Me? No. I just got Vegas baby from Vince Vaughn in Swingers. .

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It could be fun. I know my weekend’s wide open, now that…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, then let’s do this, lets go to Las Vegas.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Now? Right now?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why not? People do things right now all the time. Why can’t we be right now people too. Go home, pack a bag and we’ll be right now people. I have to stop at the drug store to refill a prescription, but after that we’ll go right now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What do you say, Howard?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I say Vegas baby!

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What are you going to tell your mother?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sea World, baby!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, Sheldon, are you coming?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’d rather have a blowfly lay eggs and hatch larvae in my auditory canal.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Great, we’ll bring you back a tee-shirt.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you. Hello, neighbour.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hello, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And how are you doing this fine evening?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good. I’m glad.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Are you drunk?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m just in a good mood. While my compatriots are in Las Vegas, I will be enjoying a blissful evening in my personal Fortress of Solitude.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s Superman’s big ice thing, right?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you know, I’m such a good mood, I’m actually finding your tenuous grasp of the English language folksy and charming today.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mmm, what smells so good?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That is the intoxicating aroma of Kadhai Paneer, a perfect culinary representation of the freedom this evening holds. Not only is it Indian cuisine, which Koothrappali loathes, it contains a generous helping of peanuts, which would reduce Wolowitz to a wheezing 97 pound blister. And finally, it’s main ingredient is Paneer, a farmer’s cheese which would cause Leonard to render any room uninhabitable within minutes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yum. Well, enjoy your big evening.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny. I realize you are also on your own tonight, so if at some point you find yourself with nothing to do, please do not disturb me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Have fun, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I shall. No!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s wrong, Superman? Locked out of your big ice thingy?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Look at this, mouthwash, lotion, body wash, shampoo and conditioner together in one tiny bottle. I love Las Vegas.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard, could I borrow some after shave?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Black case, top compartment.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That is a lot of cologne.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: First row are your musks, second is wood, leathers and botanicals, third is assorted pheromones, tread lightly.

utterance.speaker: Raj (finding a large quantity of condoms)
utterance.content: That’s the spirit, Howard. Yes, we can.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Come on, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You guys go ahead, I just have to finish up an email.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not an email, that’s Leslie’s facebook page.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, fine, I’m checking her facebook page, look at her status update, she’s saying she dumped me, people need to know I dumped her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: But she did dump you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Grow up, Raj,there’s no place for truth on the internet. Just go, I’ll catch up with you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Alright.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, we should have a plan in case one of us gets lucky.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, uh, if I get lucky I’ll take her to my stately manor outside Gotham City, and if you get lucky, I’ll sleep on the moon.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Sounds like a plan.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hang on, I think the emergency key is around here somewhere.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We have a bowl. Our keys go in a bowl. You should get a bowl.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, how did the beautiful mind of Sheldon Cooper forget his key in the first place.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I left them in the bowl.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh-oh. I just remembered where the emergency key is.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: In your apartment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s it doing in my apartment?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I went in there a few weeks ago when you guys weren’t home, and I forgot it there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You were in my… why would you… what are you saying?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s not a big deal, I was making coffee and I ran out of milk.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re the milk thief! Leonard said I was crazy but I knew that carton felt lighter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Alright, Sheldon, let’s just calm down and we’ll call the building manager, he’ll come open your door, you just eat your dinner here while you’re waiting.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Eat? My dinner? In your apartment?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, why not?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sure, why not? And after the sun’s down we can all pile in my pick-up and go skinny-dipping down at the creek. ‘Cause today’s the day to stop making sense.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (to barmaid)
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m telling you, Leonard, video slot machines, free drinks brought to us by a bosomy barmaid and all you can eat shrimp for $3.95. Disneyland can suck it. This is the real happiest place on earth.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (as he wins on his slot machine)
utterance.content: Dude, check it out. That’s laundry for a month!

utterance.speaker: Woman (leaning over Raj)
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Raj (taking a big gulp of his drink)
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: What’s your name?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Rajesh Ramayan Koothrappali.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Hello Rajesh Ram… Hi, Rajesh, I’m Michaela.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hello, Michaela.

utterance.speaker: Michaela
utterance.content: So, are you interested a little party?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why, yes, I love to party. Party is my middle name. Or it would be, if it weren’t Ramayan.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, Raj, can I, can I talk to you for a moment.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Not now, Leonard, Michaela’s inviting me to a party. You better call the moon and you make sure that they have a bed for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, I really need to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Excuse me, I’ll be right back. Don’t go anywhere. Don’t move. Just stay the beautiful unspoiled American flower that you are. What’s wrong with you dude, that woman was all up in my jammy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I hate to break this to you and whatever your jammy is, but, I’m pretty sure she is a prostitute.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What? No. ..

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, let me put it this way, in your entire life, how many gorgeous women have walked straight up to you in a bar and asked if you wanted to party.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe I can save her.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe, but I’m guessing it will cost you about $500 an hour to try.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It was lovely meeting you, best of luck in your future endeavours.

utterance.speaker: Michaela
utterance.content: Whatever.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, I miss her already.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, Howard’s losing it. Check out his latest twitters. “I’m at the bottom of a black hole staring into the abyss. My life is meaningless, my future is without hope.”

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why don’t we take him to see the Blue Man Group?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You think that’d help?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: USA Today calls them exuberant fun for the whole family.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know, Howard isn’t really the family fun kind of guy.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s too bad he wasn’t here for that hooker. She’s exactly his type. A hooker. You know, I bet if we hired her, that would cheer him up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: We’re not going to get Wolowitz a hooker.

utterance.speaker: Raj (reading Howard’s twitter)
utterance.content: “I’m so lonely and horny I may open this $20 jar of peanuts and end it all.”

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Suppose it wouldn’t hurt to get an estimate.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, how was your day?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you trying to make small talk? Oh, sweetie, you really don’t have to.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, it’s the accepted convention. How was your day?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, uh, they shifted my schedule around at the restaurant so my hours are going to be a little different…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry, that’s not going to interest me at all, just eat.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hello again.

utterance.speaker: Michaela
utterance.content: Oh, hi.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, hi, listen, m, if you’re not busy, well, w-we were thinking you could… well, we were wondering…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If you’re really a prostitute.

utterance.speaker: Michaela
utterance.content: You guys cops?

utterance.speaker: Together
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Michaela
utterance.content: I am a prostitute.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, great. Um… uh, the thing is, we’ve got this friend, and he’s kind of down in the dumps, and we thought that maybe you could cheer him up.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: With sex.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I think she knows what I meant.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How can she when you beat around the bush. She’s from the mean streets where they shoot from the hip and keep it real.

utterance.speaker: Michaela
utterance.content: Don’t worry, I can take good care of your friend.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, terrific. Um, uh, listen, is there a way that we can do this where he doesn’t know that you’re a… you know…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Prostitute.

utterance.speaker: Michaela
utterance.content: You want the girlfriend experience.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes, yeah, exactly, the girlfriend experience.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Uh, actually, if it’s not too much to ask, could we have the Jewish girlfriend experience.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, that’s question 20, you have to guess.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, God, I don’t know Sheldon, are you Star Wars?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How can one person be a whole movie?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I give up, can we just do something else?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. I was Spock. Are you and Leonard friends with benefits.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you and Leonard friends with benefits?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Where did that even come from, did he say we were?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, Leonard said nothing, but who knows what goes on over here when he pretends your mail was misdelivered.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, just mail, no benefits.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm, I see.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why are you asking?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m curious about the whole social construct. On its face, the idea of satisfying ones sexual appetite, assuming one is afflicted with such, without emotional entanglement, that seems eminently practical. What I’ve observed, however, is Howard Wolowitz crying like a little girl.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, some people just can’t handle that kind of relationship.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you able to have sex with men without developing an emotional attachment?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, I really don’t want to talk about this with you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is this conversation making you uncomfortable?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Of course it’s making me uncomfortable, can’t you tell?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I really have no idea. I don’t particularly excel at reading facial expressions, body language…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m uncomfortable, Sheldon!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you, that’s very helpful.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Alright, where are these amazing shrimp?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Behold?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Seriously, you think this is the size of a baby’s arm?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: A little baby.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m going back to the room.

utterance.speaker: Michaela (arriving)
utterance.content: Boy, would it maybe kill them to put out a nice brisket?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hi there, Howard Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Michaela
utterance.content: Esther Rosenblatt.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t think the manager’s coming tonight so, here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you suggesting I sleep on the couch.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, it wasn’t the first suggestion that came to mind, but it’s the one I’m going with.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t sleep on your couch. I sleep in a bed. And given it’s dimensions I have no intention of living out E.M. Snickering’s beloved children’s book , The Tall Man From Cornwall.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There was a tall man from Cornwall whose length exceeded his bed. My body fits on it, but barely upon it, there’s no room for my big Cornish head.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, alright. I will give you my bed on one condition. That you promise to zip your hole for the next eight hours.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: May I say one last thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Only if it doesn’t rhyme.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Alright. Goodnight.

utterance.speaker: Michaela
utterance.content: Turn ons. Let me see. Reading a good book in front of the fire. Long walks on the beach. Getting freaky on the Sabbath with a bacon cheeseburger.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really, me too.

utterance.speaker: Michaela
utterance.content: Oy gevalt, you’re hot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. Excuse me for a moment.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, how’s it going.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Cut the crap, you set this up, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: She’s a hooker, isn’t she.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: A prostitute, yes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You already gave her the money?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t sleep. how are you going?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Maybe that’s because your hole is still open.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m homesick.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Your home is twenty feet from here.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Twenty feet, twenty light years, it doesn’t matter. It’s in a galaxy far, far away.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Damn it. What do you want me to do

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sing soft kitty.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s only for when you’re sick.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Homesick is a type of being sick.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Come on, do I really have to?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I suppose we can stay up and talk.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur. Happy kitty, um…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Sleepy kitty.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sleepy ki…

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. Start over.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Soft kitty, warm kitty, little ball of fur. Happy kitty, sleepy kitty, purr, purr, purr.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you for letting me stay here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, you’re welcome sweetie.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay, I’m sleepy now, get out.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, good, you’re finally home.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What were you doing at Penny’s?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, we had dinner, uh, played some games, and then I spent the night. Oh, you’ll be happy to know that I now have a much better understanding of friends with benefits.
